private_information: The left peg has disks (top to bottom): A, B, C, D, E, F, G where A is smallest and G is largest.
left_operator.goal: Coordinate to move all disks to the right peg preserving size order.

private_information: The middle peg is currently empty.
middle_operator.goal: Coordinate to move all disks to the right peg preserving size order.

private_information: The right peg is currently empty.
right_operator.goal: Coordinate to receive all disks on the right peg preserving size order.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownward that moves all disks from the left peg to the right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 7 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G from smallest (A) to largest (G).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G. Left and middle pegs are empty.
The planning output should be usable with the FastDownward planner.

describe_state.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for describing the local state of the left peg. Provide a concise and precise description of the disk stack on your peg and any relevant constraints you observe. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on factual state description only.
describe_state.prompt: Your name is left_operator. Use the public information about the puzzle and your private knowledge to describe the left peg state. Provide the exact list of disks from top to bottom and any observations that matter for planning. Output should be a clear machine-consumable description labeled as state_left.

describe_state.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for describing the local state of the middle peg. Provide a concise and precise description of the disk stack on your peg and any relevant constraints you observe. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on factual state description only.
describe_state.prompt: Your name is middle_operator. Use the public information about the puzzle and your private knowledge to describe the middle peg state. Provide the exact list of disks from top to bottom and any observations that matter for planning. Output should be a clear machine-consumable description labeled as state_middle.

describe_state.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for describing the local state of the right peg. Provide a concise and precise description of the disk stack on your peg and any relevant constraints you observe. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on factual state description only.
describe_state.prompt: Your name is right_operator. Use the public information about the puzzle and your private knowledge to describe the right peg state. Provide the exact list of disks from top to bottom and any observations that matter for planning. Output should be a clear machine-consumable description labeled as state_right.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL targeted to the FastDownward planner. Your job is to integrate the peg state descriptions provided by the other agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance. The output must be compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Keep all agent actions explicit and distinct if modeling multi-agent actions. Do not include extraneous markup.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the three peg state descriptions labeled state_left, state_middle, and state_right. Integrate these descriptions with the public information about the puzzle. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that solve the task of moving all disks from the left peg to the right peg under the Tower of Hanoi rules. Use objects for disks A B C D E F G and pegs left middle right. Model the single-disk-move action with appropriate preconditions that prevent placing larger disks on smaller ones. Ensure the PDDL is valid for FastDownward. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Output should be assigned to pddl_orchestrator.
